social_posts.post_text:
In the deep of midnight, with candles ablaze, we came together to proclaim the Gospel of the Risen Christ, knowing in our hearts that as He is risen from the dead, so it shall be for every one of us, who believe in His Holy Name and live in His Holy Light.
.
.
.
📸 @goarch / @bnewmanphoto 
Service for the Anastasis, April 15, 2023 at @archcathedralnyc

"Who will roll away the stone for us?" (Mark 16:3) Forgiveness is the power that lifts the stone and paves our way to love, for God forgives all and asks us to do the same. There is a very real resurrection to be had in this life, which leads to life everlasting. Christ is Risen! Χριστός Ανέστη!
.
.
.
📸 @goarch / @bnewmanphoto 
Agape Service, April 16, 2023 at @stnicholaswtc

Honored by National Intelligence University President Dr. Cameron’s and Dr. Sotiriadis' invite to the Presidential Lecture Series. I discussed Russia's weaponization of religion in the invasion of Ukraine, aiming to deepen understanding in the US national security community. Appreciative of the warm reception and the engaging dialogue.
.
.
.
📸 Courtesy of The National Intelligence University

Yesterday, the National Shrine of Saint Nicholas— whose name means “the Victory of the People”— welcomed for the very first time the Presidential Guard of Greece. During our Doxology, we prayed with more urgency and more devotion:

That Greece and Cyprus are always free and secure.

That America and the free Nations of the earth always remember Greece, the Mother of Democracy.

That we, as free peoples, always hold true to the principles of our Democracies, and defend them against all who would subvert our liberty.

On behalf of all, I thank the President of the Republic @presidencygr for giving permission to the Φρουρά to share in our festivities for the Annual Greek Independence Day Parade in New York. 
.
.
.
📸 @goarch / @bnewmanphoto and @photopanagos 
At @stnicholaswtc

On Friday, we marched to Bowling Green, where, every year, the honor to raise our National Standard is afforded to our community, thanks to efforts of the Federation of Hellenic Societies of the Greater New York, and we are grateful to them for their dedication to this occasion.

May we ever be worthy of the blessings of liberty, and manifest deep gratitude and appreciation for our homeland of Greece, which was so proudly represented at the ceremony by the elite Evzones.
.
.
.
📸 @goarch / @bnewmanphoto and @photopanagos

The Greek Independence Day Parade always stirs emotions, but this year in NYC, being with countless community members, young and old, marching for hours, even in a relentless downpour, was profoundly touching. God Bless you, Omogeneia! 🇬🇷🇨🇾💙🌧️ #RainOrShine
.
.
.
📸 @goarch / @bnewmanphoto

This past Friday, we marched with the Presidential Φρουρά from the Saint Nicholas Greek Orthodox Church and National Shrine in order to gather here at Bowling Green and raise the emblem of Greek Independence.
.
.
.
🎥 GOARCH / Panos Satzoglou, Valantis Skoufris

This wonderful and deeply moving Greek Independence Day Parade in New York City. 🇬🇷🇨🇾💙🌧️ #RainOrShine 
.
.
.
Courtesy of Antenna TV/ Thanasis Tsitsas
Subtitles VideoPress

It was a profound blessing and honor to visit His Beatitude Theodoros II, Patriarch of Alexandria and All Africa, today with our GOARCH pilgrimage group. 

We rejoice in the example His Beatitude has set in his remarkable missionary work, and we are grateful for the true fraternity between the Alexandrian and the Ecumenical Patriarchates.
.
.
.
📸@goarch / Nader Smile Fotos

What a joy to celebrate the Divine Liturgy with His Beatitude Theodoros II, Pope and Patriarch of Alexandria and All Africa, in the majesty of the historic Cathedral of the Annunciation. We give thanks unto God for granting us the blessing of worshiping together with our Greek Orthodox sisters and brothers in Egypt.
.
.
.
📸@goarch / Nader Smile Fotos

On this blessed #MothersDay, I find myself reflecting on the selfless love & wisdom of my own mother. Her faith has been my guiding light, her love, my strength. To all mothers, thank you for the love you give so freely. May God’s blessings be upon you today and always.
.
.
.
📸 @goarch / @bnewmanphoto

On this solemn day of remembrance, we honor the lives lost and the lives shattered a century ago in the Pontic Genocide. We pray to the Lord for the repose of their souls and their eternal memory.
.
.
.
📷 @bnewmanphoto / GOARCH

Today we honor the name day of His All-Holiness, our Ecumenical Patriarch, Bartholomew, and our hearts are filled with joy. Our celebration began yesterday with the Great Vespers at St. Bartholomew's Church in Manhattan. Εις πολλά έτη Δέσποτα.
.
.
.
📸 @goarch / @douglasjohnphotography

In March 2022, we set to raise $1 million for the people in Ukraine impacted by the Russian invasion. Since then, the joint efforts of @goarch and @ioccrelief have surpassed our fundraising goal. My heartfelt gratitude to all our faithful who generously donated. 
.
.
.
📸 @omarmarquesphoto / Getty Images

Four years from your loving, generous, and grace-filled welcome to me as your Archbishop. My heart overflows with gratitude for each and every sister and brother of our Church in America. You are my first thought in the morning and my last prayer at night. Thank you!

Πέρασαν τέσσερα χρόνια από τη ζεστή, γενναιόδωρη και αγαπητική υποδοχή στον Αρχιεπίσκοπό σας. Η καρδιά μου είναι γεμάτη από ευγνωμοσύνη για όλους τους αδελφούς και τις αδελφές μου στην Εκκλησία της Αμερικής. Είστε η πρώτη μου σκέψη το πρωί και η τελευταία μου προσευχή το βράδυ. Σας ευχαριστώ!

📸 @goarch / @photopanagos and @bnewmanphoto

I was delighted to meet the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Greece, George Gerapetritis, at @GreeceMFA. I wished him success in his new role. The spirit and mission of our Church and Omogeneia in the USA are aligned with the beating heart of Hellenism.
.
.
.
📷GOARCH

Excellent meeting with Minister of Education, Religious Affairs and Sports Kyriakos @pierrakakis. We're looking forward to strengthening the partnership between @goarch and his ministry, elevating Hellenic education and culture in the USA for our Omogeneia and fellow Americans.

It was a great honor to meet today, on a tough day for Greece, due to the forest fires, with Greek Prime Minister @kyriakos_ Mitsotakis, whom I congratulated on his election victory. I had the opportunity to discuss with him the issues concerning Hellenism, Omogeneia, and our Church in America, as well as the proposed legislation that will remove the restrictions of Greeks abroad to vote in their place of residence, something our expats are longing for. It is my duty to serve the interests of our national center and the rights of our Ecumenical Patriarchate, like all my predecessors.

Ήταν μεγάλη μου τιμή να συναντηθώ σήμερα, σε μια πολύ δύσκολη ημέρα για την πατρίδα μας λόγω των πυρκαγιών, με τον Πρωθυπουργό Κυριάκο Μητσοτάκη, τον οποίο συνεχάρην για την εκλογική του νίκη. Μου δόθηκε η δυνατότητα να συζητήσω μαζί του τα θέματα που αφορούν στον Ελληνισμό, στην Ομογένεια και στην Εκκλησία μας στην Αμερική, καθώς και το νομοσχέδιο για την άρση των περιορισμών στη δυνατότητα των Ελλήνων του εξωτερικού να ψηφίζουν στον τόπο διαμονής τους. Αυτό είναι κάτι που περιμένουν όλοι οι ομογενείς μας. Καθήκον μου είναι να υπηρετώ τα συμφέροντα του εθνικού μας κέντρου και τα δίκαια του Οικουμενικού μας Πατριαρχείου, όπως όλοι οι προκάτοχοί μου.

In the embrace of our Lord, Marianna Vardinogianni, a cherished friend, has found rest. Tireless advocate for children's rights, dedicated President of “Elpida,” the Association of Friends of Children with Cancer, her legacy will live on. May she find eternal peace in His kingdom.

Holy and Sacred Synod Elects H.G. Bishop Apostolos of Medeia as Metropolitan of New Jersey

The Holy and Sacred Synod of the Ecumenical Patriarchate convened today, July 24, 2023, and elected His Grace Bishop Apostolos of Medeia as Metropolitan of New Jersey.

In the wake of this consequential decision, His Eminence Archbishop Elpidophoros of America shared the following reflections:

"With profound joy, I extend my fervent congratulations to His Eminence Apostolos on his election to the seat of the Metropolitan of New Jersey. I pray that our Lord grants him wisdom and abundant blessings as he assumes the sacred duties entrusted to him by our Church. The Metropolitan has devotedly served our Archdiocese as a priest in the Metropolis of Boston and the Archdiocesan District, as Chancellor of the Metropolis of San Francisco, as Chief Secretary to the Holy Eparchial Synod, and as a faithful and capable custodian of the liturgical and pastoral responsibilities of the Metropolis of New Jersey for the past several years. I hold steadfast confidence that his spiritual gifts and earned experience and knowledge will guide his ministry in fruitful and loving service of our Greek Orthodox parishes in the Holy Metropolis of New Jersey."

His Eminence continued: "We are deeply grateful to His All-Holiness Ecumenical Patriarch Bartholomew and the Holy and Sacred Synod of the Ecumenical Patriarchate. Their decision illuminates a path of renewal as we continue to build an Archdiocese that is ever more united, empowered, and dedicated to fulfilling its sacred mission."

The date of the Metropolitan’s enthronement is forthcoming. Meanwhile, His All-Holiness has announced that Metropolitan Apostolos has been invited to participate as a member of the Holy and Sacred Synod for one year, beginning at the start of the next synodical period on September 1, 2023. In a special Encyclical, His Eminence Archbishop Elpidophoros exhorts the Metropolis of New Jersey clergy to commemorate Metropolitan Apostolos in services as the canonical hierarch, starting today.

On Tuesday, July 25, with the blessings of His All-Holiness Ecumenical Patriarch Bartholomew, His Grace Bishop-elect Theophan of Philomelion was ordained to the episcopacy during the Divine Liturgy presided over by His Eminence Archbishop Elpidophoros of America at the Patriarchal Cathedral of Saint George, at the Phanar.

In his address, Archbishop Elpidophoros stated: “You, Bishop-Elect Theophan, are called to bring to your ministry in America the same ‘trans-national and spiritual force’ that His All-Holiness speaks of, to minister to the faithful over whom you shall preside in love. You have been elected to fulfill the place of your late predecessor and elder brother in the See of Philomelion, the ever-memorable Metropolitan Ilia. May his memory be eternal!”

His Grace offered the following response: “I was born and raised in Albania during the communist regime in a time when there was no church and organized church activities, but where there was faith in the hearts, souls, and minds of the faithful people. It was this kind of belief that kept kindled the light of the faith in me since my childhood, that light that in time grew in my heart and mind, becoming the fire that warmed my soul, longing for my Orthodox Faith my belief and for the service to the martyred Church of Christ, especially the one from my native country of origin, the martyred Albania… Since his All-Holiness Ecumenical Patriarch Bartholomew, to whom I am grateful for the trust and blessings, ascended to the Ecumenical Throne, he has always kept in his mind and heart his role as Shepherd of the Oikoumene, the father of those who are scattered around the world.”

His Grace Bishop Theophan of Philomelion will serve the Albanian Diocese of the Ecumenical Patriarchate in the USA and Canada. He was elected on June 28, 2023, by the Holy and Sacred Synod at the proposal of His All-Holiness Ecumenical Patriarch Bartholomew. The date of the Bishop’s enthronement is forthcoming.

(Read in full @orthodoxobserver / www.goarch.org/news )

📸 @goarch

My first official visit to @ionianvillage , our beloved @goarch summer camping ministry, was a joy. I was honored to meet some of its dedicated stewards and neighbors in Ilia, Greece— and to spend time with this year’s campers and staff, together with Ambassador and former camper George Tsunis (@usembassyathens ).

I am grateful to all who continue to make this ministry a success; on its 50th anniversary, Ionian Village is still a place like no other, where our young people meet their Orthodox faith, and one another, in a transformative new light.

Three years after Hagia Sophia’s conversion from a museum to a mosque, we pray for its restoration to a place that welcomes all people. Until then, let us build the House of Wisdom in our hearts, where by love and forgiveness, we can always worship within the Great Church in our deepest souls.

📸 @goarch / @bnewmanphoto

On the Transfiguration, we can see clearly that the Cross— ascended by the Lord out of His unconditional love for every human being— is the very glory of God. And we can share in it by our willingness to love unconditionally all those whom God brings into our lives.

📸 @goarch / @photopanagos

We celebrate the Dormition of the Virgin as the passage of the Holy Theotokos from death to life. She who willingly gave her human nature to God, now receives the perfection of eternal life. In beholding her, we can see our own future. Glory to God for His miraculous Mother!
Once again, privileged and honored to commence the Ecclesiastical Year in the presence of His All Holiness at the Sacred Center of Orthodox Christianity.

On our first day in Panama, I had the opportunity to visit the St. John Paul II Center and learn about the incredible efforts to support those battling homelessness and drug addiction. We were warmly welcomed by Ariel López, the Director of the Center. Later at Hogar Luisa, Director Jorge Ayala briefed us on their commendable work assisting migrants. At Kol Shearith Israel Synagogue, we were greeted by Rabbi Gustavo Kraselnik, Head of the Synagogue and President of the Interreligious Committee of Panama.

Honored to be received by President Laurentino 'Nito' Cortizo in the beautiful country of #Panama, on the occasion of the 510th anniversary celebration of its Patroness, Santa María La Antigua. Our Greek Community here is a vital part of Panamanian society.

Photos: GOARCH/Brittainy Newman

Grateful for the warm and productive meeting with Janaina Tewaney Mencomo, Foreign Minister of #Panama. The Greek community takes pride in contributing to Panama's diverse tapestry, bound by shared values.

Photos: GOARCH/Brittainy Newman

As we reflect on this somber day, let us recall Romans 12:21: 'Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.' In remembrance of the lives lost, let us choose love over hatred and faith over fear. #September11

Photo: GOARCH/Brittainy Newman

Honored to welcome Cyprus's President, @nikoschristodoulides to @GOARCH. We are committed to justice in Cyprus, as dictated by the @unitednations Sec. Council resolutions and international law, safeguarding the fundamental freedoms and human rights for all, and won't waver until achieved.

Photos: GOARCH/Tom Galanis

After meeting in Athens this past July, a pleasure to meet again the Prime Minister of Greece, Mr. @kyriakos_ Mitsotakis in NYC, during the UN Week.

Photo: Manatos & Manatos

Honored to welcome to the Greek Orthodox Archdiocese the Deputy Prime Minister & Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Bulgaria Mariya Gabriel and reaffirm the bonds of faith and history between our Patriarchates and cultures. Another example of the opportunities that the UN General Assembly brings.

Photo: GOARCH

text_entities.entity: deputy prime minister & minister of foreign affairs

social_posts.post_text: Presvytera Nikki Stephanopoulos was a pillar of our Archdiocese for decades, and her passing into eternal glory is as much a loss for us, as it is a gain for her. I extend the deepest condolences of the Holy Eparchial Synod and the entire Archdiocese to Father Robert, an exceptional clergyman of our Church, and to her children and grandchildren. We shall always treasure her manifold contributions to our Church, and with a heavy yet grateful heart, we pray, may her memory be eternal.

While in Kefalonia, we visited the Municipal Homes for the Elderly. On the same day, we visited Peratata to venerate the relics of Saint Andrew and to receive a tour of the Ecclesiastical Museum. As I said to our host, His Eminence Metropolitan Demetrios of Kefalonia, we have come to this beautiful island with our delegation from the USA to strengthen the bonds of brotherly love and friendship, which are based on our common faith in the life-giving God.

Photos: GOARCH/Vasilis Loukatos
null

What a joy it was for us to celebrate Great Vespers at the Holy Monastery of Saint Gerasimos in Omalon with Metropolitan Demetrios and the faithful of Kefalonia and the US. Earlier in the day, we were honored to venerate the open and full Relic of the Saint.

Photos: Vasilis Loukatos

Yesterday evening, the @orderofsaintandrew Patriarch Athenagoras Human Rights Award was most worthily bestowed upon the Prince’s Trust, an initiative of King Charles III which has for decades led the way in preparing the youth of today for the challenges of tomorrow. We were honored by the presence of our dear friend, the Prince’s Trust International’s Vice-President, who represented His Majesty at the award ceremony. 

Begun for the benefit of disadvantaged youth in the United Kingdom, the Prince’s Trust International has now impacted over one million young people, across twenty-two nations, including many in Greece. These young people faced enormous employment challenges during the years of economic hardship, and we thank the Prince’s Trust International for its investment in the human capital of Greece.

And if we are going to encourage human rights across the board for all people, we must instill in the coming generations the values and understanding of these rights, which are based in freedom of conscience and religious liberty – the very principles that the Order of Saint Andrew, Archons of the Ecumenical Patriarchate, exemplifies.

Photos: John Mindala

It was a blessing to conclude our pilgrimage to Kefalonia on the feast of the island’s patron, Saint Gerasimos. I am grateful to His Eminence Metropolitan Demetrios, beloved friend and academic colleague, for the opportunity he gave us to be here as pilgrims.

Photos: Vasilis Loukatos

I was blessed to join the Metropolis of San Francisco community at their gala honoring His Eminence Metropolitan Gerasimos of San Francisco with the Theofanis Economides Award. His Eminence faithfully leads and serves the Metropolis of San Francisco and the entirety of the Sacred Archdiocese of America with a devotion to stewardship, humility, and service. We are inspired by his example of dutiful faithfulness to Christ and His Holy Church.

Photos: Kostas Petrakos

I am humbled by your well-wishes on my Nameday— and all the more by your generosity and unwavering stewardship of our Church’s mission in the lives of young people.

Thanks to the overwhelming support of our faithful at yesterday evening’s Gala celebration, we have raised over $400,000 for the Archdiocesan Youth Summer Camp Scholarship Fund. Our Orthodox summer camps have always been rich grounds for our young people to explore their faith in community, disconnecting from the digital world and reconnecting with nature and one another in Christ.

Photos: GOARCH/Brittainy Newman

Today, we celebrate St. Iakovos Tsalikis of Euboea, who was canonized by the Phanar in 2017 during my time in the Synod, and whose profound presence I have experienced as a blessing throughout my ecclesiastical life. 

It is no coincidence that every Orthodox altar is founded upon the relics of a Saint; they are our living hope, our strength, and our bond with the heavens.

Video by Pavlos Tripodakis

Editing by @panosatzoglou

@rishisunakmp’s decision to abruptly cancel his meeting with @kyriakos_ over the Parthenon Sculptures deeply insults Greeks worldwide. These Sculptures are beacons of our shared human heritage, and their reunification in Athens fulfills UK’s moral and historical responsibility.

Once again, I am grateful to join the children of Saint Basil Academy for their annual Christmas Pageant. The presentation was filled with great talent that inspires joy in our hearts this Nativity Season. May the Lord, through the prayers of Saint Basil the Great, grant unto us all the gladness of heart inspired by these children, as we embrace Christmas and the New Year.
.
.
.
📷 GOARCH/Brittainy Newman

It was my great pleasure to welcome the children of our Parochial Schools to our Archdiocese and hear their joyful songs. Let us bask in their glow, with gratitude for the blessings of our precious children, and let us praise the God of Heaven and Earth, Who willed to become a little child for our sake, in the little town of Bethlehem, so long ago.
.
.
.
📷 GOARCH/Brittainy Newman

It was my distinct honor to visit Senior Rabbi Joshua Davidson at @emanuel_nyc, the first Reform Jewish congregation in NYC, on the Upper East Side in Manhattan. I wished him and the Jewish community, located in same neighborhood as the Archdiocese Headquarters, a blessed Hanukkah.

Photos: GOARCH

Always a joy to meet with Congressman @gusbilirakis. A proud son of our Church and of the Greek American community, serving the people of Florida. He is a protector of the Ecumenical Patriarchate, and always supports Greece and Cyprus.

Photo: GOARCH

I am grateful to have had the opportunity to speak at the 40th anniversary celebration of Manatos & Manatos, in Washington, DC. I also spoke about the need to support Ukraine’s struggle for peace and justice. We were fortunate to have Speaker Emerita Nancy Pelosi with us, a person of faith and a devoted servant of the American people.

We attended our Annual Cathedral Christmas Concert on Saturday evening, a remarkable blend of spiritual harmony and cultural heritage. Congratulations to maestro extraordinario Costas Tsourakis and our accomplished Archdiocesan Cathedral Choir & Youth Choir and Cathedral Orchestra.

I am delighted that so many of our faithful came to our Sacred Archdiocese to share in the festive season that celebrates the birth of our Lord, who was born for our salvation. In welcoming all of you to the Archdiocese, I recognize the importance and value of every member of our Sacred Eparchy of the Ecumenical Throne. We are in this together, as the One Body of Christ.

Photos: GOARCH/Dimitrios Panagos and Brittainy Newman
Christ is Born! Glorify Him!
Χριστὸς Γεννᾶται! Δοξάσατε!

It was a great joy to receive His Excellency Archbishop Borys Gudziak of the Ukrainian Greek Catholic Archeparchy of Philadelphia. We spoke about the struggle of the Ukrainian people against the brutal Russian invasion. In the Greek Orthodox Archdiocese of America we pray for peace and justice to prevail in Ukraine.

location.city_name: Greek Orthodox Archdiocesan Cathedral of the Holy Trinity

social_posts.post_text: Christ is Born! Glorify Him! Χριστὸς γεννᾶται! Δοξάσατε! Let us welcome the Babe of Bethlehem with all our hearts. The gifts that we shall receive in return far exceed anything we could imagine, for they are the unfathomable riches of Christ.

It was an honor to celebrate the Feast of St. Barbara with the blesséd Cathedral community of the Slavic Orthodox Vicariate in America. You are a powerful witness, for you have chosen to honor the history of Slavic Christianity by placing yourselves under the protection and spiritual aegis of the Ecumenical Patriarchate of Constantinople. This sends a strong signal to the Orthodox World about the value and importance of being connected to the Mother Church, the Great Church of Christ. May your continued connection with the Ecumenical Patriarchate of Constantinople bring blessings and strength to your community.

Camera: Valantis Skoufris
Post-Editing: Panos Satzoglou

View on YouTube @ArchbishopElpidophoros

On this first day of the New Year of 2024, let us embrace the newness in Christ, which He has appointed for our renewal and salvation. And let us bring this renewal to a weary and war-torn world, which needs our prayers, our compassion, and our love.

Photo: GOARCH/Dimitrios Panagos

On the Holy Theophany, we celebrated the great tradition of Tarpon Springs with beloved Hierarchs. The Immersion (Gk. Κατάδυσις) of the Precious Cross reminds us all that through sacrificial love, God’s grace is spread throughout the world, like the waters of the sea.

Photos: GOARCH/Brittainy Newman
Archbishop of America (@goarch)
